title: Move Efficiently Through Dense Jungle
brief: Develop 'jungle eye' and proper movement techniques for efficient jungle travel.
steps: Step 1: Always wear long sleeves to prevent cuts and scratches.
Step 2: Focus vision on jungle further out, not immediate front vegetation.
Step 3: Look for natural breaks in foliage rather than cutting through everything.
Step 4: Stop and crouch occasionally to look along jungle floor for game trails.
Step 5: Move slowly and steadily, stopping periodically to listen and take bearings.
Step 6: When using machete, stroke upward when cutting vines to reduce noise.
Step 7: Use stick to part vegetation and dislodge dangerous creatures.
Step 8: Turn shoulders, shift hips, bend body to slide between undergrowth.
warnings: Do not grasp at brush or vines when climbing - they may have sharp thorns or spines.
Sound carries long distances in jungle - minimize cutting noise.
Do not cut unnecessarily or you will exhaust yourself quickly.
